name: Hampton Inn San Diego-Sea World/Airport Area

reviews.text: Stayed one night for a conference at nearby Town & Country Conference Center in the Hotel Circle region. This Hampton Inn was as expected: well-maintained building and a spacious room. Local neighborhood is not so great, but if you have a car and are just staying in the hotel, it will not matter. It takes just a few minutes to drive to the conference center at Hotel Circle on I-8. Wireless internet access in the room was OK but a bit slower than I have come to expect at a hotel. Overall a good value for the cost and I will be back for the next conference in this area.
reviews.title: Fine place near Hotel Circle and Sea World

reviews.text: We stayed here for one night in October and had were mostly very happy with it.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Good Value

reviews.text: The location is just a few minutes drive to SeaWorld, which was the main reason I chose it.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, but make sure you lock your doors

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sure the general area isn't ideal as other reviewers have pointed out, but we weren't wandering the streets at night so it wasn't a problem for us.
reviews.title: There are better options available

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is showing its age a little, but is generally very clean. We could clearly hear the people in the next room talking and people upstairs walking around, so that was a little annoying, but not too bad.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: Title says it all. You'll trade a horrible bed - it is springy with NO support at all - and a location amongst the homeless living in their beat-up motor homes for a well priced stay with free parking. Do yourself a favour and head over to Old Town and stay at the Holiday Inn Express or Courtyard.
reviews.title: Decent rate, free parking, horrible beds, so-so location

reviews.text: This is NOT your typical Hampton Inn. I am amazed that the brand would allow this 25 year old property to carry their signage. What ever happened to brand identity? The breakfast buffet and color scheme match but that is where it ends. I can't say enough about how bad the mattress was; soft, springy and no support at all. It feels 25 years old even though the staff tells me all the bedding is new. If the beds are new, they are not Hampton Inn issue. No attempt to address the issue when I complained (twice) about it either.
reviews.title: Great service and a great value!

reviews.text: We needed a hotel for a small business meeting. The Hampton Inn Old Town / Sea World was the perfect choice!
reviews.title: Close to Sea World

reviews.text: The staff made sure all of our attendees were happy and made a point of exceeding our expectations. The meeting space was comfortable and well equipped.
reviews.title: Great Place...Good Value...Well Maintained...Convenient Location...but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is convenient to everything.
reviews.title: A different Hampton Inn!

reviews.text: The Hilton name means nothing any more. I have always trusted that Hilton properties would meet a certain basic level of expectations. This hotel has proven me wrong!
reviews.title: THIS is a Hilton property? I don't see how...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In all ways, this hotel is a Comfort Inn or Days Inn, with the Hampton Inn name slapped on it. TERRIBLE!!! DO NOT waste your money. And, it's not as convenient to Sea World as advertised.
reviews.title: very quiet!!!!

reviews.text: Parking is ridiculous. They don't even have enough parking for one vehicle per room. Outrageous.
reviews.title: Clean rooms, good value, good location

reviews.text: Forget getting the room you reserved. We reserved a room with a sofa bed, refrigerator and microwave. And, yes, we booked this way in advance of our trip. When we arrived, we got a room with two beds, a desk and a TV - no sofa bed, no refrig and no MW. They were "out" of those rooms and "out" of refrigs to even send to the God forsaken room we ended up in.
reviews.title: Excellent Service, Clean, Great Breakfast

reviews.text: It is 2am and I should be comfortably sleeping in my Hilton property hotel room, but cannot get to sleep because of a literally constant noise coming from the elevator, which is next to our room. I've stayed in hotel rooms next to elevators before, and never have I been kept awake all night by elevator noise.
reviews.title: Great deal...especially if you're going to the Sports Arena

reviews.text: My family of three (15 year old son) stayed here for three nights from thursday until sunday and really liked this hampton. It looks really new as the lobby is very large and spacious and the rooms are nice. The beds are extremely comfortable and very quiet. It is very close to several local attractions such as the beach, Sea World, Old Town, Sports Arena, and Downtown/Airport. I really enjoyed the fact that the breakfast, parking, and wireless internet in the room and lobby were all complimentary. There was also complimentary coffee and tea 24 hours in the lobby.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel with fair value and good breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The swimming pool and hot tub was relaxing and clean and the staff was very friendly. We stayed in a 2 Queen Bed Deluxe for $129 a night and it was very fair priced. There are also several nearby restaurants and fast food places such as Olive Garden, In N Out, Denny's, Del Taco, Rubios, Subway, and Phil's BBQ (one of the best restaurants in SD - only about a mile away). The area is better and safer than it seems. The only negative was that there was no view from our rooms, but we didn't mind too much.
reviews.title: Excellent bed as all Hampton Inn!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent service and accommodations. The location is regular, some fast food chains nearby, near San Diego Sports Arena and some strip clubs.
reviews.title: Good Place to Stay

reviews.text: When we checked in, there were a couple of problems with the room, but the front desk sent a maintenance man immediately to address both quickly. He even brought us a bag of candy for our troubles!
reviews.title: Great Location but times change

reviews.text: The rate was excellent-$89 and the room was large. We could even see the Sea World fireworks from the window. The hotel is large and spread out but not a problem. Location was good - near airport, Point Loma and not far from Sea World. The Olive Garden and Red Lobster were good restaurants nearby. Point Loma Seafoods was excellent with reasonable prices. Corvette Grill was great with 50's era Corvette, movies, menu and waitresses dress.
reviews.title: One of the better Hampton Inns

aka: Hampton Inn San Diego Airport / Seaworld Hotel San Diego
description: The Hampton Inn San Diego-Sea World/Airport hotel is conveniently located near Old Town and Sports Arena Blvd. We are within walking distance of Old Town and San Diego Trolley Station. We are minutes from the airport, Sea World, San Diego Zoo, beaches and downtown. We are also near to Point Loma Nazarene University, USD, SDSU, UCSD. Enjoy our Free breakfast each morning and free wired and wireless internet access.
